description: Indulge in the luxurious taste of almond croissants, where rich buttery pastry meets a luscious almond filling. Perfect for reviving day-old croissants, this recipe transforms them into a delightful treat that pairs beautifully with your morning coffee.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon dark rum (or 1 teaspoon vanilla extract)
instructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a small saucepan, combine sugar, water, and rum. Cook over medium heat until the sugar dissolves completely (1-2 minutes). Set aside to cool.
In a bowl, whisk together almond flour, all-purpose flour, and salt.
In another bowl, mix softened butter and powdered sugar until smooth. Add the egg and almond extract, mixing until combined. Fold in the almond flour mixture until smooth.
Slice each croissant in half horizontally. Brush both cut sides generously with the cooled simple syrup.

Spread about 2 ½ tablespoons of frangipane on the bottom half of each croissant. Place the top half back on and spread 1 ½ tablespoons of frangipane on top. Sprinkle with sliced almonds, pressing them gently to adhere.
Place croissants on the baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes, or until golden brown and fragrant.
Let cool slightly, then dust with powdered sugar. Serve warm for the best flavor and texture.
tips: To achieve the best results, ensure your croissants are slightly stale for optimal syrup absorption. Don't skip the powdered sugar dusting for an elegant finish.

  • Supporting ingredients: Almond flour gives a nutty flavor, while powdered sugar adds sweetness.
  • Equipment needed: Baking sheet, parchment paper, small saucepan, mixing bowls, whisk.

Assemble croissants with frangipane and bake until golden brown.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Use slightly stale croissants for the best texture.
  • Avoid over-soaking the croissants to prevent sogginess.
  • Look for a golden-brown color to indicate doneness.
  • Store in an airtight container for short-term freshness.

structured_content.content: Sharing these almond croissants with friends over coffee brings back memories of cozy mornings and laughter. They are a reminder of the joy of good food and great company.
Consider adding chocolate chips or orange zest to the frangipane for a unique twist. A hint of cinnamon can also enhance the flavor profile.
Pair these croissants with a strong espresso or a delicate tea for a delightful experience. They also go well with fresh fruit or a side of whipped cream.
Try substituting half of the almond flour with finely ground pistachios for a nutty variation, or reduce the sugar for a low-sugar version.
